Written by

January 17, 2023

Skiing is already super fun and upbeat, but sometimes you need a little extra
pick me up for those park sends and powder days. Or you may want to mellow out
and have a nice, sunny ski day. Whatever it is you're after, a pair of
headphones might be the missing piece you're looking for.

Once you try headphones for skiing, there is no going back. But the wrong pair
of headphones can be uncomfortable and potentially dangerous depending on the
type of rider you are.

In this guide, I'll show you the nine best headphones for skiing and help you
choose the right pair for every ski day.

## My Review Process

As a kid, I skied in groups a lot and never felt the need to have something in
my ears, but as I got older and my days lined up less and less with others, I
began to ski alone. I found that sometimes it’s nice to plug into music,
audiobooks, or podcasts on the slopes.

I’ve spent a lot of time on the slopes and have tried many music players to
find the perfect fit for me. I don’t always listen to something when I ski,
but having the option anytime I feel like I need something extra is excellent.

I’ve tried various ski headphones, including wireless, wired, and in-helmet
speakers. Here are my top picks for the best ski helmet headphones.

## Wired Vs Wireless Ski Helmet Headphones

Wireless ski headphones are more convenient and compact, but check the battery
life and remember that the connection isn't always the best in the mountains.

While many headphones are shifting to wireless, there are still many great
wired options to pick from. Wired headphones have an advantage because you
never have to worry about battery life. But ensure you have a convenient spot
for your device so the wires don't get in the way.

## Type Of Ski Helmet Headphones

There are many different options for ski and snowboard helmet headphones.
There are some with better audio quality, some with a more user-friendly
intercom system, and others with long-lasting battery life.

The following section will explain what features and qualities to look out for
when buying headphones for skiing.

## Ski Helmet Headphones Buying Guide

### Price

Depending on whether your headphones are wired, wireless, or built-in to your
helmet, ski headphones can have a wide price range.

If you are new to skiing and want to see if you like skiing with sounds, then
the cheaper models will be a great start. If you are a die-hard skier who
loves to ski to music all day, you will want to go with a more expensive
option as it will have more features and most likely last longer.

If you are somewhere in-between, a middle-of-the-pack sports headphone would
be a great pick. Just be sure to make sure the headphones you pick have the
features you want and need.

### Sound Quality

Sound quality is one of the most essential features to consider when buying a
music player. It would be a shame to purchase headphones and not even be able
to hear the music or your phone calls. Make sure the headphones you pick
provide a crystal-clear sound that can shine through even on the windiest
days.

### User-Friendly

Being user-friendly is another important feature to watch out for. You don't
want to make all your friends wait because you are fumbling around with your
headphones to change the song or make a phone call.

All headphones operate differently, and it's up to you if you prefer a hands-
free option, glove-friendly choice with easy-to-click buttons, or a quick tap
on your helmet. Choose an option that seamlessly fits in with your ski setup.

### Durability

When choosing any piece of gear that is a bit expensive, it's nice to know
that the equipment will last through any weather and terrain. Make sure they
are durable enough to survive crashes and are good for all conditions.

### Safety

You don't want your headphones to be completely soundproof. When listening to
music, you must also be able to hear what is happening around you to avoid
collisions.

Ensure that your headphone wires are not in a position where they can wrap
around your head during a fall. You also want to make sure that your
headphones aren't so bulky they could dig into your head and injure you during
a fall.

Headphones should have a slim design and fit easily into your ski gear, making
them almost unnoticeable. This will make them a more comfortable and safer
addition to your ski day.

## Summary

Ski helmet headphones can make communicating on the mountain effortless and
add a lot of fun to your day.
